events.title: Launch of Sputnik 1
events.description: The Soviet Union launched the world's first artificial satellite, Sputnik 1, marking the start of the space age and the space race.
events.significance: Sputnik 1's launch demonstrated Soviet technological capability, initiated the space race during the Cold War, and spurred advancements in space exploration worldwide.

events.title: Pope Paul VI Becomes First Pope to Visit the United States
events.description: Pope Paul VI arrived in New York City, becoming the first pope to visit the United States and addressing the United Nations General Assembly.
events.significance: This visit marked a significant step in improving Vatican relations with the US and highlighted the global role of the Catholic Church.

events.title: Gregorian Calendar Introduced
events.description: The Gregorian calendar was first implemented by order of Pope Gregory XIII, reforming the Julian calendar to better align with the solar year.
events.significance: The calendar reform improved the accuracy of the date system used internationally, affecting civil and religious events.

events.title: Establishment of Standard Time Zones in the United States and Canada
events.description: Railroads in North America adopted standardized time zones to solve scheduling confusion due to local times varying by location.
events.significance: This innovation standardized timekeeping, facilitating commerce, communication, and transportation across vast distances.
